section.heading: Establishment of the Criminal Code Reform Commission.

para.text: The Criminal Code Reform Commission ("Commission"") is established as an independent agency within the District of Columbia government, consistent with the meaning of the term "independent agency" as provided in section 301(13) of the District of Columbia Government Comprehensive Merit Personnel Act of 1978, effective March 3, 1979 (D.C. Law 2-139; D.C. Official Code § 1-603.01(13)).
The Commission shall be composed of the Executive Director and such staff as necessary to complete the work of the Commission.

Except as provided in paragraph (2) of this subsection, the Executive Director shall be appointed by the Chairman of the Council, subject to the approval of the majority of the Council. The Executive Director shall serve for a term of 3 years, or until the Commission is dissolved pursuant to section 3127, and shall be paid a rate of compensation as may be established from time to time by the Council.

Notwithstanding paragraph (1) of this subsection, as of the effective date of this subtitle, the Criminal Code Revision Project Director of the District of Columbia Sentencing and Criminal Code Revision Commission shall be the Executive Director of the Commission.
Be a member in good standing of the District of Columbia Bar;
Be responsible for and oversee the daily operations of the Commission;
Develop and institute internal policies, procedures, and processes to ensure efficient operations.
Except as provided in paragraph (2) of this subsection, all employees of the Commission shall be, or shall become within 180 days after hire, a resident of the District of Columbia
Notwithstanding paragraph (1) of this subsection, the Executive Director as of the effective date of this subtitle shall be exempt from the residency requirement in paragraph (1) of this subsection.
